alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 07 at 2:09PM EST until January 11 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Watch, minor to moderate coastal flooding possible. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Wednesday evening. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Tuesday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Water levels could be highest around the time of high tide, particularly east of Carrabelle where the high tide is closer to midday. Water could overwash coastal roads and even impact non-elevated structures in flood prone areas like Alligator Point and Saint Teresa. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
